intro: Isotrema kaempferi, commonly known as the white sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help it spread vegetatively. Isotrema kaempferi plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
